Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Myticalin B1 (Arg-rich; natural AMPs; mollusca/molluscs/mollusks, marine invertebrates, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 40% similarity toA3-APO.  Molecular formula:  C128H197N43O33; Mol Wt 2864.    GRAVY= -1.73; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide:  1.47  kcal/mol.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 8-16 uM), A. baumannii ATCC 19606 (MIC 8 uM), and B. subtilis ATCC 6051 (MIC 32 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Leoni G, De Poli A, Mardirossian M, Gambato S, Florian F, Venier P, Wilson DN, Tossi A, Pallavicini A, Gerdol M.2017
Literature Information.Reference: Mar Drugs. 2017 Aug 22;15(8). pii: E261. doi: 10.3390/md15080261.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Myticalins: A Novel Multigenic Family of Linear, Cationic Antimicrobial Peptides from Marine Mussels (Mytilus spp.).
